title: Show HN: I was curious about spherical helix, ended up making this visualization
author: damarberlari
aiHeadline: Curiosity about spherical helix leads to mind-blowing 3D visualization, proving that sometimes getting lost in space is the best way to find your passion.

title: Ask HN: Why does the US Visa application website do a port-scan of my network?
author: mbix77
aiHeadline: Ask HN: Why does the US Visa website feel the need to do a port scan on my network? Because the government wants to make sure you're not hiding anything... or maybe they just want to know if you have a printer.

title: Zedless: Zed fork focused on privacy and being local-first
author: homebrewer
aiHeadline: Zedless: The new privacy-focused fork of Zed that's all about being local-first, because who needs the cloud when you can have everything on your own computer? Except your data, which apparently wants to be everywhere.

title: Pixel 10 Phones
author: gotmedium
aiHeadline: Pixel 10 Phones: Google's latest attempt to convince you that you need a new phone, even though your current one works perfectly fine. Because nothing says 'upgrade' like a slightly better camera and a shorter battery life.

title: Gemma 3 270M re-implemented in pure PyTorch for local tinkering
author: ModelForge
aiHeadline: Gemma 3 270M re-implemented in pure PyTorch for local tinkering: Because who needs a supercomputer when you can just use your own laptop to train a model that will probably crash your system anyway?
